content.headline: TYPE CHART
content.body: The cornerstone of Pokémon strategy. Every move possesses an Intrinsic Type (the attacker) that mathematically interacts against the Type of the target Pokémon (the defender) defining the final damage. Mastering these relationships is the difference between a decisive hit and a wasted turn.

technical_notes.label: Super effective (x2)
technical_notes.tooltip: The move deals double damage against Pokémon that are weak to that type.

technical_notes.label: Not very effective (x0.5)
technical_notes.tooltip: Damage is reduced by half when the defending Pokémon resists the move's type.

technical_notes.label: Immune (x0)
technical_notes.tooltip: Certain Pokémon types take no damage from moves of specific types.

content.headline: DUAL TYPES
content.body: Many Pokémon possess two types simultaneously, creating a unique combination for their effectiveness charts. This allows multipliers to stack, drastically amplifying both defensive strengths and weaknesses.

technical_notes.label: Double weakness (x4)
technical_notes.tooltip: Occurs when both of the Pokémon's types are weak to the same move type, doubling critical vulnerability.

technical_notes.label: Double resistance (x0.25)
technical_notes.tooltip: Occurs when both of the Pokémon's types resist the attacking move type, reducing damage to an operational minimum.

content.headline: HEALTH POINTS
content.body: Health Points (HP) define the operational vitality of a Pokémon. This stat determines how many hits it can withstand before being knocked out and forced to leave the field.

technical_notes.label: Vital Endurance
technical_notes.tooltip: With higher HP, a Pokémon has greater staying power against any category of attack.

content.headline: PHYSICAL STATS
content.body: This axis governs physical category exchanges. Attack determines the strength with which the Pokémon executes these moves, while Defense mitigates the impact of physical attacks received from the rival.

technical_notes.label: Attack (Atk)
technical_notes.tooltip: Stat that boosts the damage of physical category moves.

technical_notes.label: Defense (Def)
technical_notes.tooltip: Stat that mitigates damage from the rival's physical category moves.

content.headline: SPECIAL STATS
content.body: Performance in special category attacks depends on this pair of stats. Special Attack governs the output power, while Special Defense is the variable that mitigates damage from the rival's special moves.

technical_notes.label: Sp. Attack (SpA)
technical_notes.tooltip: Stat that boosts the damage of special category moves.

technical_notes.label: Sp. Defense (SpD)
technical_notes.tooltip: Stat that mitigates damage from the rival's special category moves.

content.headline: SPEED
content.body: The Speed stat is the decisive factor for taking the initiative. Under normal conditions, the Pokémon with the highest Speed value will execute its move before the opponent in each turn.

technical_notes.label: Speed Tiers
technical_notes.tooltip: Speed comparison where outspeeding the rival by a single point guarantees priority of action.

content.headline: BASE STAT TOTAL (BST)
content.body: BST is the sum of a Pokémon's six base stats. This number allows for identifying the general potential and quality of a species within the competitive environment compared to other species.

technical_notes.label: Mixed Attackers
technical_notes.tooltip: Pokémon with offensive stats spread evenly. They can attack from both spectrums but are often less efficient than specialists.

technical_notes.label: Min-Maxing
technical_notes.tooltip: A high BST is not always better; often a distribution that concentrates potential into key stats is superior to an inefficient even spread.

content.headline: ACCURACY AND EVASION
content.body: Variables that do not appear on the main sheet but alter combat. Accuracy determines the probability of a move hitting, while Evasion reduces the chances of being hit.

technical_notes.label: In-Battle Modification
technical_notes.tooltip: These are not fixed values; they are altered by buffs/debuffs (Stages from -6 to +6) which directly impact hit consistency.

content.headline: THE MOVE
content.body: Every move is defined by its Type and two key values: Power, which establishes base damage, and Accuracy, which indicates the probability of success when executing it.

technical_notes.label: Move Type
technical_notes.tooltip: Intrinsic elemental property that determines effectiveness against the rival and STAB activation.

technical_notes.label: Base Power
technical_notes.tooltip: Numerical value that determines the raw power of the attack before applying external multipliers.

technical_notes.label: Move Accuracy
technical_notes.tooltip: Intrinsic probability that the move will not miss when selected.

technical_notes.label: Additional Effects
technical_notes.tooltip: Secondary properties of certain moves that can induce status conditions, alter target/user stats, or modify the field and terrains.

content.headline: STAB BONUS
content.body: STAB (Same Type Attack Bonus) is an automatic damage bonus. If a Pokémon uses a move that shares one of its elemental types, the power of that attack increases by 50%.

technical_notes.label: Type Matching
technical_notes.tooltip: Aligning the Pokémon's type with its moves is essential for maximizing offensive damage potential.

content.headline: MOVE CATEGORY
content.body: Moves are divided based on how they calculate damage. Physical Attacks pit the user's Attack against the rival's Defense, while Special Attacks pit Sp. Attack against Sp. Defense.

technical_notes.label: Physical Category
technical_notes.tooltip: Calculates damage based on the attacker's Attack against the defender's Defense.

technical_notes.label: Special Category
technical_notes.tooltip: Calculates damage based on the attacker's Sp. Attack against the defender's Sp. Defense.

content.headline: STATUS MOVES
content.body: Not all moves aim to deal direct damage. They are essential tools for combat control and tactical resource management through secondary effects and disruption.

technical_notes.label: Buff / Debuff
technical_notes.tooltip: Alteration of stat levels (Stages) for the user or the rival.

technical_notes.label: Status Condition
technical_notes.tooltip: Induction of status problems such as Paralysis, Burn, or Sleep.

technical_notes.label: Field Control
technical_notes.tooltip: Environment modification through the activation of Weather, Terrains, or the setting of Traps.

technical_notes.label: Utility & Disruption
technical_notes.tooltip: Flow control through speed disruption, redirection, or volatile state management.
